about_me.intro: I'm Taylor Kuno, a software developer who believes AI is transforming how we build software, and I want to be part of that transformation. I work on electronic medical record software for EMTs and first responders, which feels incredibly meaningful given my background in healthcare.
about_me.current_role: Software Developer at Sansio in Duluth, Minnesota (approaching 3 years)
about_me.passion: Using AI tools to learn faster and build better software, especially tools that help people in high-stress situations
about_me.location: Based in Duluth, Minnesota - love the North Shore and Lake Superior
about_me.background: Before tech, I spent 7+ years working directly with people in crisis situations as a psychometrist and youth counselor in a residential mental health program. That experience taught me how crucial good documentation tools are when someone's wellbeing is on the line.

current_job.duration: September 2022 - Present (started as intern, full-time since January 2023)
current_job.what_i_do: Build electronic medical record software specifically for EMTs, firefighters, and police officers who need to document in high-stress, pre-hospital situations
current_job.collaboration_story: I work closely with product team members who are former EMTs - they help me understand the real-world constraints and keep me from over-engineering solutions. Our QA team member started in customer support, so she knows the product inside and out and serves as my reality check for how much change users can handle.

major_projects.name: Apple Store UI Overhaul
major_projects.story: When I joined the MobileTouch team, our CSS was scrambled and inconsistent - mixed fonts, broken icons, accessibility issues. Since Apple's HIG has strict standards, we had a lot of work to do. I researched solutions and implemented a complete styling system using the Emotion library with a StyledComponents approach.
major_projects.scope: Over 300 hours of work coordinating across multiple teams
major_projects.impact: Apple didn't reject a single aspect of our UI during submission, and when changes went live, we only had a few minor bugs to resolve
major_projects.what_i_learned: How to lead a major technical change while bringing the whole team along. Getting buy-in early made all the difference.

major_projects.name: AI Tools Leadership Initiative
major_projects.story: I've been leading our company's adoption of AI development tools. I test everything from GitHub Copilot to Cursor to Amazon Q, then develop strategies to help our team integrate these tools effectively.
major_projects.approach: We focus on building a culture of experimentation rather than instruction. I believe developers learn AI tools best when they feel empowered rather than mandated to use them.
major_projects.current_focus: Using AI to improve our code documentation and testing suite, plus running hackathons on low-priority features to practice with new tools in low-pressure situations
major_projects.recognition: My AI integration ideas have been selected for grant applications and received positive feedback from company leadership

current_job.growth_story: Started as an intern with no formal JavaScript or React training - I taught myself these technologies because I could see they'd be important. Now I'm mentoring our new intern and leading major technical initiatives.
current_job.daily_variety: I love that our small team means I work on everything from simple label updates to full feature implementations. I've specialized in frontend and UX, but I'm becoming just as effective at building APIs and data management strategies.

internship_start.story: Worked on the web admin tool that manages configurations for the MobileTouch product. My main project was helping migrate legacy framework code to JavaScript and React - which was particularly satisfying since I'd taught myself these technologies.
internship_start.learning_moment: This internship validated my decision to self-teach React and JavaScript outside of my Python-heavy computer science program.

psychometrist_role.what_i_did: Administered neuropsychological testing to patients ages 1 to adult, built rapport quickly to ensure valid test results, and provided detailed documentation for neuropsychologists
psychometrist_role.key_skills_developed: Building trust rapidly under pressure, maintaining standardized procedures while adapting to individual needs, multi-tasking documentation while staying focused on the person in front of me
psychometrist_role.documentation_challenges: Had to maintain perfect standardization while keeping each child calm and motivated. Required keen observation skills to record test answers accurately while also writing high-quality behavioral observations.
psychometrist_role.personal_systems: I developed shorthand methods for tracking documentation on the fly and learned to systemize my process to record things accurately while staying attentive to the patient's experience
psychometrist_role.first_programming_spark: Spending hours scoring tests manually led me to create Excel programs to streamline the process and catch errors. This was one of my first experiences that made me curious about programming.
psychometrist_role.why_it_matters: Helping children receive correct diagnoses meant they could access services they needed to thrive. This experience taught me how crucial accurate documentation is when someone can't advocate for themselves.

project_coordinator_role.story: During a lull in psychometrist responsibilities, I organized Epic EMR training across all outpatient specialty care clinics in the system
project_coordinator_role.scope: Worked with managers and practitioners across multiple clinics to help them use Epic more efficiently for documentation
project_coordinator_role.key_insight: I saw the full spectrum of responses to new technology - some providers were already power users, others were excited to learn, and some struggled to shift their workflows for various reasons
project_coordinator_role.connection_to_current_work: This experience directly informs how we're approaching AI tool adoption at Sansio. The one-on-one mentoring sessions were crucial for helping skeptical or less technical users trust the process and try something new
project_coordinator_role.lasting_impact: Learned about the real difficulties of documentation and meeting patient needs, which motivates me to make our EMT software as user-friendly as possible

youth_counselor_experience.roles: Youth Care Counselor → Lead Youth Care Counselor → Senior Mental Health Practitioner
youth_counselor_experience.core_responsibilities: Provided basic needs, maintained safety, guided youth using strength-based interventions, facilitated core skills groups, trained other staff in de-escalation techniques
youth_counselor_experience.crisis_management: Learning to stay calm when someone else is escalating, showing comfort around people in vulnerable states to build trust and create safety
youth_counselor_experience.documentation_reality: Had to do narrative documentation, often pen-and-paper during crisis situations, then write things up on computer later. It was challenging remembering details after time had passed - would have been useful to have better in-the-moment documentation tools
youth_counselor_experience.teamwork_insights: Managing conflicting priorities of patient safety and documentation relied on established procedures and high levels of teamwork. Having well-defined processes that everyone was trained on was crucial for stepping into high-stress situations with everyone on the same page
youth_counselor_experience.connection_to_emt_work: These experiences help me sympathize with EMT work and give me lived understanding of how having the right documentation system can make a big difference in patient outcomes

north_shore_vertigals.mission: Creating opportunities for women-identifying and non-binary community members to begin or advance their rock climbing skills
north_shore_vertigals.technical_contribution: Built the website from scratch using Next.js, TypeScript, React, and vanilla CSS. I wanted to practice the Next.js skills I was learning at work and create an accessible way to communicate our goals to people who don't use social media.
north_shore_vertigals.collaboration: Working with a new board member who had UX/UI experience made the website project much less intimidating - I could share design and content workload while focusing on the technical implementation
north_shore_vertigals.leadership_approach: When I became president, our post-COVID engagement was low and board members were burned out. I emphasized scaling back events to find a sustainable rhythm that drove better engagement while being feasible for volunteers to run

major_initiatives.name: Nuts of Steel Film Festival
major_initiatives.description: Community event screening rock climbing films with women leads, used as fundraising and community building opportunity
major_initiatives.impact: Drew 70+ people, helped solidify our place in the community

major_initiatives.name: Before-Hours Climbing Events
major_initiatives.description: Regular climbing sessions outside normal gym hours
major_initiatives.impact: Bring up to 30 women together each session

north_shore_vertigals.impact: We now do less repetitive work while generating higher engagement. Our approach is sustainable and our community knows what to expect from us
north_shore_vertigals.current_reach: Before-hours events: up to 30 participants, Film fest: 70+ people, Skills clinics and social events: typically 10 women each

picnic_quest_game.name: Picnic Quest
picnic_quest_game.description: Text-based adventure game where Junimo the cat and Marni the dog collect items around the home to attend a neighborhood picnic in the park
picnic_quest_game.role: Built React frontend and helped with Python backend
picnic_quest_game.creative_elements: Created pixel art for the main character Junimo, while my teammate wrote all the original dialogue to create a cute, heartwarming experience
picnic_quest_game.naming_story: Characters named after our real pets - Junimo and Marni
picnic_quest_game.current_status: No longer live due to other life priorities, but we hope to return to it someday
picnic_quest_game.what_it_represents: My final portfolio project at Oregon State University, showing I could collaborate on a full-stack application with creative elements

music.story: Started playing guitar as a teenager, took a break during my 20s, now back with renewed passion for writing my own music
music.collaboration: Love playing music with my husband and close friends, hope to collaborate on a live project someday

writing.approach: I start with journaling-style stream of consciousness, then distill that down to poetry
writing.what_i_love: The power of saying more with less and finding the right word to capture an emotion or concept
writing.current_focus: Returning to writing after losing track of it for a while, finding renewed enjoyment

visual_arts.jewelry_making: I make jewelry from natural stones I find while agate hunting on Lake Superior beaches

zine_design.name: Dogshit Zine
zine_design.description: 72-page visual publication designed for independent skate film - comprehensive layout design, typography, and photography curation project
zine_design.collaboration: Worked with filmmaker (my husband) on complete visual identity and publication design
zine_design.scope: Full project management from concept to digital publication
zine_design.note: Tongue-in-cheek art project showcasing design range and personality

outdoor_activities.rock_climbing: Core passion that led to my volunteer leadership role
outdoor_activities.hiking: Love hiking with my German Shepherd Marni along Lake Superior shorelines
outdoor_activities.skateboarding: Another way I stay active and challenge myself
outdoor_activities.aerial_arts: Recently tried silks and hammock classes - always looking for new ways to challenge myself
outdoor_activities.favorite_spot: Wisconsin Point - long, often empty beach where I can let Marni off leash while I hunt for agates and beach stones

pets.marni: 10-year-old German Shepherd who's been with me since she was a puppy, still as energetic as ever
pets.mr_al: Marni's younger cat brother - they're great friends
pets.shared_weakness: Everyone in our household, including Marni, is addicted to Jalapeño Cheddar Cheetos

cooking.background: Spent childhood in San Diego, fell in love with Mexican food and developed a crippling guacamole addiction
cooking.current_focus: Love experimenting with cuisines that are harder to find in the Midwest, plus comfort foods like chicken gnocchi soup with home-grown herbs

home_life.community: My husband and I have neighbors who count as our 'found family' - this core community brings so much meaning to our lives

unique_interests.norwegian_heritage: Recently started learning more about my Norwegian heritage, collecting books and memorabilia from the Viking Era
unique_interests.twin_connection: I have an identical twin sister who works in UX/UI and was a huge resource when I was making my career shift into tech

personality_and_work_style.how_coworkers_describe_me: Quick learner, driven, creative, someone who can infuse energy into a project and set a vision to aim for. I'm good at working with different kinds of people and well-liked throughout the organization
personality_and_work_style.mentoring_approach: Often given opportunities to train others - currently working with our new intern on redoing a health monitoring page
personality_and_work_style.collaboration_style: I learn a lot from coworkers about how to temper dreams into reality and rely heavily on their input to fine-tune my ideas
personality_and_work_style.fuel: Like many developers, I'm powered by coffee and guilty pleasure snacks
personality_and_work_style.decompression: After stressful days, I love getting outside to clear my mind by my favorite tree at the lake, or spending time laughing and connecting with friends
personality_and_work_style.learning_philosophy: Always on the lookout for new ways to challenge myself - whether that's aerial arts, skateboarding, or the latest AI development tools

work_topics: Career transitions from healthcare to tech
personal_topics: Duluth, Minnesota and the North Shore
Having an identical twin in tech
learning_topics: Aerial arts and new physical challenges

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.programming_foundation: Program was Python-heavy, but I taught myself JavaScript and React because I could see they'd be important for my career goals
education.capstone: Built Picnic Quest text-based adventure game as final portfolio project

contact_and_links.note: Feel free to ask me about anything from EMT software development to rock climbing to agate hunting on Lake Superior!
